titles.title: Restoring Congressional Oversight and Strengthening Military Jointness Act

To impose conditions on the disestablishment, closure, or realignment of the United States Joint Forces Command and on workload reductions of civilian personnel of that command, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 9/15/2010--Introduced. Restoring Congressional Oversight and Strengthening Military Jointness Act - Prohibits the Secretary of Defense (DOD) from effecting or implementing the disestablishment, closure, or realignment of the United States Joint Forces Command, or conducting any civilian workload reductions at such Command, until: (1) 30 legislative or 60 calendar days have passed since the Secretary has notified the congressional defense committees of a proposed disestablishment, closure, or realignment; and (2) the Comptroller General has submitted to such committees an independent assessment of such proposal.
